docs.lead_paragraph: Policy experts and others are weighing the repercussions of a possible decision by the Supreme Court to strike down the federal health care law.

headline.main: Sense of Peril for Health Law Gives Insurers Pause
headline.print_headline: A Health Law At Risk Gives Insurers Pause

docs.abstract: Insurers, hospitals and policy experts are weighing the widespread repercussions that would result should the Supreme Court strike down the health care law, forcing them to abandon major changes and billions of dollars spent since the law was passed in 2010; reversal would be particularly difficult for insurance companies, which have adapted to numerous provisions of the law that have already been implemented.
docs.snippet: Policy experts and others are weighing the repercussions of a possible decision by the Supreme Court to strike down the federal health care law.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and KATIE THOMAS
